page.title: 15TREFRIFAWR FARM ABERDYFI
page.content: Located on the steep mountainside overlooking the northern shore of the Dyfi estuary{Trefrifawr Farm}is a typical Welsh hill farm. The farm buildings are a mixture of old and new,the oldest dating from 1738.The farm itself consists of permanent pasture,rough grazing and woodland.Hay grown on the flatter fields is the only crop on this livestock farm. A flock of Welsh mountain ewes crossed with a Suffolk ram produce approximately 300 lambs per year,a small herd of Welsh Blacks provide calves for sale at 12/14 months and two breeding sows produce 2 litters per year. A farm trail at 80p/adult is a recent innovation.It remains to be seen how far the present tourist boom will influence what is a working farm
